instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
Very complicated Mac.

It arrived without recognizing MagSafe and cooler fired. I only discovered the oxidized <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>. I cleaned everything and replaced it, the Mac worked perfectly for 2 days and stopped recognizing the MagSafe (no LED and the system does not recognize the connected MagSafe). I took it apart to test, it worked again. A day passed, it stopped recognizing Magsafe, when I disconnect the battery, it recognizes MagSafe again.

Note: When it was working, recognizing MagSafe, whenever I connected MagSafe, the Mac would turn on.

I changed the DC board and cable, the battery and it didn't solve the problem. Using original MagSafe.

I'm waiting for it to stop working again to check voltages.

With it working:
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.6v
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> pins 17.18 - 4ohms, 27.28 - 20ohms

Maybe the bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
I tried reballing and changed the SMC. It didn't solve it.

As long as there is charge in the battery, it turns on and works. But it doesn't recognize the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Tried disconnecting BIL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
Diode mode in both - 0.560
BIL? MacBook Air?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
I get confused with a 2936 I was working with on my desk.

Do you get amber light on the Magsafe?
Did you try SMC bypass mode?

Check resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
When it doesn't recognize the charger, I don't have any light. Battery icon on MacOs also shows charger connected.

I had already tested the ISL, pins 17.18 - 4ohms, 27.28 - 20ohms

The Mac turns on, do I test it in SMC bypass mode to check if it charges the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
SMC bypass is a good option to try.

Tried known good LIO flex/board?
Inspect J9500's solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not recognize charger
threads.message:
I had used a scrap SMC, I wasn't sure if it worked 100%.

I ordered another SMC and it seems to work.
